channel.title: Semantic Entailment :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: Definition We say a set of premises, p1, p2, …, pn semantically entail a conclusion c, and we write: p1, p2, ..., pn ⊨ c if whenever we have a truth assignment that makes p1, p2, …, pn all true, then c is also true for that truth assignment. (Note: we can use the ASCII replacement |= instead of the Unicode ⊨, if we want.) Showing semantic entailment Suppose we have premises p ∧ q and p → r. We want to see if these premises necessarily entail the conclusion r ∧ q.
